results.title: Olympic invitation
results.creator_credit: Roy A. Driver and Herschells Films
results.brief_description: The film that is said to have won the approval of the Olympic Games committee in Rome in 1949, and thus won for Melbourne the honour of being chosen as the site for the 1956 Olympic Games. Shows the attractions of Melbourne and in particular its advantages as a venue for the 1956 Olympic Games.

results.title: Olympic games 1956
results.brief_description: A survey of Melbourne Olympic Games; opening by the Duke of Edinburgh; arrival of the Olympic torch carried by Ron Clarke; Olympic oath taken by John Landy. Highlights of events. Closing ceremony in which athletes took part for the first time as individuals.

results.title: Olympic Century : the Olympic Spirit
results.creator_credit: Stewart Binns, Dirk Glaser, Thomas Lewis and Transworld International
results.brief_description: This video tells the story of the Modern Olympic Games. From the humble beginnings in 1896 to the most widely watched television extravaganza in the world, there has been a fascinating, dramatic and at times controversial journey. It opens with a dramatic overview of the entire Olympic spectacle and then goes on to explore the rediscovery of the heritage of the ancient world in the 19th century and how the games came to be inspired by the ancient games. It also looks at the celebration of the Olympic festival and how the games have grown to become what they are today.

results.title: Olympia: the film of the XI Olympic Games, Berlin 1935. - [Parts I and II]
results.brief_description: A two part record of the controversial 1936 Berlin Olympics. Part 1 contains a stylised glorification of ancient Greece, the carrying of the Olympic torch to Berlin, and the opening ceremony. Part 2 opens with scenes of athletes training and relaxing at the Olympic Village. Sporting events covered are swimming, athletics and diving, gymnastics, riding, rowing, cycling, yachting, shooting, hockey, polo and soccer. Intended as a glorification of the Nazi Regime.

results.title: Oliver Twist. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Gareth Davies, Terrance Dicks and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: Mrs Maylie and her adopted daughter, Rose, take pity on Oliver and nurse him back to health. Fagin and Monks plot to seize Oliver once again but Nancy reveals that Rose is the young sister of Oliver’s mother. The wicked Monks is packed off abroad with his half of the family legacy. Oliver is adopted by Mr Brownlow, and they settle down to live in the same neighbourhood as the Maylies.

results.title: Olive Cotton: photographer
results.creator_credit: Kathryn Millard and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: Olive Cotton who began her career in the 1920’s is one of Australia’s most accomplished photographers. Her bold images, often associated with the “modernist” paintings and photographs of the 1930’s and ‘40’s, strike a strong chord with contemporary interests. Unlike many other female photographers of the period, Cotton did not restrict her work to portraiture but tackled a wide range of commercial subjects. This archival interview provides a unique look at the artist and her opinions of her work.

results.title: Olga
results.creator_credit: John Sheppard and Granada International Productions
results.brief_description: Olga Korbut is the Soviet gymnast who, at the age of 17, won three gold medals at the Munich Olympic Games in 1972 with a performance that caught the hearts and imaginations of a world-wide audience. This is a study of the hard and uncompromising disclipine that is a necessary part of a world champion’s daily life.

results.title: Ole eyemo sees the truth
results.brief_description: John, an imaginitive boy lives at a theme park with his aunt and uncle. After painting a third eye on his forehead, he uses his new organ of sight to gain small insights into the complex and confounding nature of human behaviour, fraught with contradictions between action and intention. Raises open-ended questions on human behaviour. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Old young man
results.creator_credit: Michael Ahnemann, Douglas Cox and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description: Bill Bradley, like any young man, is sorting out his thoughts and thinking possibly of a career in public life. But Bradley isn’t just any young man. He is a nationally known high school and college basketball star, Rhodes scholar, and member of a professional basketball team. See Bill Bradley through his own eyes.
